text: Ronald Ludington (September 4, 1934 â€“ May 14, 2020) was an American figure skating coach and pair skater. He worked with his wife Nancy Rouillard Ludington. He was the 1960 Olympic bronze medalist, 1959 World bronze medalist, and a four-time U.S. national champion. He was born in Boston, Massachusetts. Ludington died on May 14, 2020 in Newark, Delaware at the age of 85. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Olympic bronze medalists for the United States Category:Sportspeople from Boston
title: Ronald Ludington
